name: Burmese Tea Leaf Salad
description: A unique Burmese salad with fermented tea leaves, nuts, and tomatoes.

name: Lumpia
description: Filipino crispy spring rolls filled with savory meat or vegetables.

name: Thai Papaya Salad (Som Tum)
description: A refreshing Thai salad with shredded green papaya, peanuts, and spicy lime dressing.

name: Chinese BBQ Pork Skewers
description: Grilled pork skewers marinated in a savory-sweet Chinese BBQ sauce.

name: Thai Chicken Satay
description: Grilled marinated chicken skewers served with a rich peanut dipping sauce.

name: Pork Siomai
description: Steamed Filipino-Chinese pork dumplings served with soy sauce and calamansi.

name: Chinese Spring Rolls
description: Crispy fried rolls filled with a mix of vegetables and sometimes meat, served with dipping sauce.

name: Burmese Samusas
description: Deep-fried savory pastry pockets stuffed with spiced potatoes, lentils, and peas.

name: Thai Fish Cakes
description: Spicy Thai fish cakes made from fish, herbs, and spices, served with a cucumber relish.

name: Chinese Fried Dumplings
description: Pan-fried dumplings filled with pork and vegetables, crispy on the outside and soft inside.

name: Sago't Gulaman
description: A refreshing Filipino drink made from tapioca pearls, gelatin, and sweet syrup.

name: Thai Iced Tea
description: A creamy and sweet Thai tea made with black tea, sugar, and condensed milk, served over ice.

name: Chrysanthemum Tea
description: A lightly sweetened Chinese herbal tea brewed with dried chrysanthemum flowers, served cold or warm.

name: Buko Juice
description: Fresh coconut juice served straight from a young coconut, a Filipino favorite.

name: Lemongrass Drink
description: A refreshing and lightly sweet Thai beverage made with fresh lemongrass and a touch of honey.

name: Bubble Tea (Milk Tea with Tapioca)
description: A popular Taiwanese-style tea with chewy tapioca pearls, milk, and sweet black tea.

name: Pineapple Tamarind Juice
description: A sweet and tangy Burmese drink made from pineapple and tamarind, perfect for hot weather.
